tr.td: 3. Cytopenias (affecting ≥2 of 3 lineages in the peripheral blood): Hemoglobin <90 g/L (in infants <4 weeks: hemoglobin <100 g/L) Platelets <100 × 10 9/L Neutrophils <1.0 × 10 9/L
4. Hypertriglyceridemia and/or hypofibrinogenemia: Fasting triglycerides ≥3.0 mmol/L (i.e., ≥265 mg/dl) Fibrinogen ≤1.5 g/L
5. Hemophagocytosis in bone marrow or spleen or lymph nodes. No evidence of malignancy
6. Low or absent NK-cell activity (according to local laboratory reference)
8. Soluble CD25 (i.e., soluble IL-2 receptor) ≥2400 U/ml

fn.p: Secondary HLH diagnosis criteria adapted from Henter et al. 2007. Five out of the eight criteria should be fulfilled.
